content: If a car travels at a constant speed of 60 mph for 4 hours, how far will it travel?

If a car travels at a constant speed of 60 miles per hour for 4 hours, the distance it will cover can be calculated using the formula:

\[ \text{Distance} = \text{Speed} \times \text{Time} \]

Given that the speed is 60 mph and the time is 4 hours, plugging these values into the formula gives:

\[ \text{Distance} = 60 \, \text{mph} \times 4 \, \text{hours} = 240 \, \text{miles} \]

So, the car will travel 240 miles.
